abstract: George T Sakato, Japanese-American who defended America in World War II and was awarded Distinguished Service Cross and later Medal of Honor in recognition for his brave deeds, dies at age 94.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Sakato was the last survivor of the seven living Japanese-American veterans to whom tribute was paid more than a half a century after they fought gallantly for a nation that feared and loathed their people.

headline.main: George Sakato, 94, Dies; Awarded Medal of Honor Long After It Was Denied
headline.print_headline: George Sakato, 94, Dies; Awarded Medal of Honor

snippet: Mr. Sakato was the last survivor of the seven living Japanese-American veterans to whom tribute was paid more than a half a century after they fought gallantly for a nation that feared and loathed their people.
